First of all, the place smells terrible and like it has not been cared for in years. The bathroom is super small, almost to a point of being dangerous. You are touching the sink as you are using the toilet. All of the wires are run under a carpet and plugged into the same extension cord (which is using the only outlet in the room), which is a clear fire hazard. Summary: We stayed at the Coast Inn Laguna Beach in October 2019 for our Wedding Aniversary. The room (Room 29 on the deck) was rustic beach chic and we loved it. It was clean, fresh and has that beachy white wood look. The only thing lacking was some funky hooks for our towels.
Room tip: Take some beach towels & your own tea/coffee cups

Summary: My boyfriend and I came to this location last year and had a nice time so we decided to come back this year.  BIG MISTAKE!!  Never in my life have I been so disappointed with a travel experience.  The pictures listed  on Airbnb are absolutely nothing close to what you actually get.   We walked into our room to discover it was uninhabitable hot!  We found a fan in the “closet” of the bedroom but it didn’t do much as it is the middle of summer in California.  We contacted our host David who took his sweet time to ensure we got another fan...three hours later!!!  By this time our experience had been ruined and we had decided to leave.   The floors are disgusting, as is the bathroom.  You cannot comfortably sit on the toilet without your face nearly hitting the sink and the shower

Summary Heading: The Coast Inn now on Airbnb-Nightmare on 1401 S Coast Hwy
Summary: Obviously the Coast Inn is closed, nevertheless the rooms still get rented via Airbnb. My wife and I were thrilled and excited to spend some days at the beach. The pictures, the description, the reviews all looked flawless. We prepaid almost 500 $ for two days.  We arrived at the proposed time. All doors were closed, and the placed looked like a resemblance of a crime scene in NYC. Next to the building is a construction site, that is filled and smells like a landfill, the access to the beach is closed. Once we managed to find our way to the apartment, we could not believe our eyes. Everything was covered with rust and dirt. The patio, the lounge chairs the umbrella look like a scenery for a horror movie. Once we managed to enter the rented flat, it was nothing like the pictured
Room tip: Dont go there it is a dump

Summary Heading: Ocean Waves Crashed All Night & Day
Summary: Biggest complaint was the lack of room service during my 4 day stay. My teenage son, fiancé, and myself had to share 4 towels between the 3 of us for 4 days! The view is absolutely breathtaking and makes up for anything lacked. We had an end room on the top floor and it had to have been the best view. It is very cramped, if you are obese I do not recommend this place as the bathroom is the size of an airport bathroom!

A group of us were here for a weekend. We had a great time but this hotel was a dump. View of the laundry room from a postage stamp sized bathroom, where you had to shower with half your body outside the shower.

I've been to Laguna many years ago. On this next trip I was unaware of the change of ownership. I made my reservation by phone & they were very kind & courteous. The rooms are nicer than I remembered them. I'm assuming some refurbishing had been done.   The hotel is an older hotel but the tranquility of that beautiful ocean view & being rocked to sleep by the waves was exactly what I needed on this trip. The price is very good considering how close to the ocean I was. The staff was very accomadating & friendly.   There is no continental breakfast but there is a restaurant below in the Boom Boom Room called the Boom Cafe that has  excellent food.   I can't wait until my next visit!  Daniel-Trip

Summary Heading: Used to be great -- now it's just SAD
Summary: The Coast Inn has never been notable for its amenities, but I used to stay there because it was right above the famous Boom Boom Room. It's rather pricey for what you get, but it's a gay hotel and I wanted to support it. However, the last straw was my most recent visit. I called the day I wanted reservations there, and I asked what was going on at the Boom Boom Room that night, since the bar and hotel share the same staff and management. I was told it was business as usual, so I made the reservation and checked in a few hours later. I took a nap and went out to the bar around 10pm. The place was dead. Forty-five minutes later, the LAST CALL was announced. The place was closing before 11pm! Apparently, if there are not enough people in the bar, they now close down early, whenever

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for the Gay/Lesbian visitor to Laguna Beach.  Right above The Boom
Summary: The Coast Inn is the PERFECT place to stay in Orange County for the Gay/Lesbian traveler.  It is fight above the largest Gay club in Orange Co., not to far from "Downtown Laguna", and only 1 block from the other gay clubs in Laguna Beach.    Personally, I would recommend one of the Suites facing the Beach and overlooking the ocean.  The sunset over Catalina Island is to die for!  And the view of the boys and girls walking on the beach ain't bad either!
